intro: Pentopetia androsaemifolia subsp. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy pentopetia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands or stream banks. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. This subspecies is often found in the southeastern United States, where it thrives in humid climates.
